poem:
### Tensions in the Air

In the dim corridors  
of power, whisperings  
ignite distant skies.   
Missiles, like migrating  
birds, trace the dark,  
fall to earth, silent  
witnesses of man's  
ageless conflict.  
The night sighs;  
fragments rain down,  
scattering seeds  
of uneasy tomorrows,  
while the soul,  
adrift in the static,  
seeks forgotten  
peace in shadows.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Moscow says first US-made Atacms missiles fired by Ukraine at its territory Moscow has said Ukraine fired six US-made Atacms missiles at Russia’s Bryansk region, in what would be the first use of the weapons on Russian territory since the Biden administration lifted restrictions. Russia’s defence ministry said in a statement that its military shot down five Atacms missiles and damaged one more. It added that fragments fell overnight on the territory of an unmanned". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
